posts.author: Dlightfull
posts.content:
Hello guys,

So, i thought i’d try again to play this game. I have tried before, i have the game a long time (it’s NWN:EE), but i never got farther than chapter 1.

The thing is i’m a perfectionist when it comes to character building. I play and develop a char and if somewhere on the way i understand that my char is not the best i can get, i just lose interest in the game itself. I am not an RP’er, i like to build very powerful chars that roll almost everything in their path, so i can just enjoy the story.

Now to the specifics. Please help me find a build that would suit my play style. Here is what i have in mind:
-        The char is mainly for OC and the DLC’s. So the level cap would be 28, as i understand. After that i might get it for a ride in other modules that would get it to 40, if i’ll like the char.
-        I want to play solo, i don’t like henchmen and companions (i just want all the xp for myself and i hate to micromanage). I might use one for a little bit when i am too weak, but i don;t want to rely on them for too long.
-        I prefer elfs, but it’s not at all important, if another race suits better the build, i’ll pick that instead.
-        I don’t really have a class preference, but I always liked archers the most in other games. As I understand, archers are a bit lacking in the area of AoE in NWN, which gets to the next point
-        The build should have some AoE potential, to kill fast weaker monsters.
-        I hate to micromanage, so I don’t like builds that have to buff before each fight. I can cast long lasting buffs (like an 100 rounds song, for example), I can buff before an important fight, but having to buff before every fight would kill the game for me.
-        I don’t really have weapon preferences, I don’t care about what armor to wear, I don’t care which type of magic to cast etc.
-        I want my char to be as powerful as possible, as soon as possible. I can grind a little, if it’s needed for the build to shine later, but I am not willing to grind 40 levels J.
-        If it’s not a caster, I’d like to not have to click to many buttons, it should work as passively as possible.

So, form my little understanding of the game, seeing how archers would get annoying to deal with weak monsters, I guess I need either a caster, or a melee build. If you happen to know archer builds that can deal with the crowd efficiently, please let me know.

If it’s a caster, I’d like to be focusing on offensive spells. I’d try a sorcerer, but I don’t know what and when to add to the mix, to squeeze the maximum out of the char.
Thank you in advance for your help and sorry for my bad English, it’s not my first language.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hi Dlightfull, and welcome!

Before we dismiss archers completely, the Arcane Archer class can be ridiculously powerful. Have a look at Mick Dagger's guide to the class in the Game Guides section for all the details. It's restricted to elves and half-elves, and you need at least 1 level of either Bard/ Sorcerer/ Wizard. That means the earliest you can start to take the class is level 8 (essentially, the end of chapter 1 of the OC, so you'd be spending that chapter building up to it), because you need a BAB of +6. If you're looking to take out weak mobs early, at level 2 AA gets the imbue arrow feat, so 3 times a day you can shoot a 10d6 fireball, which should help.

Anyway, have a read and a think.

Cheers

posts.author: neo.dietrich
posts.content: If you're going to do a solo caster run, I'd suggest a sorcerer build. Not as versatile as a wizard, but you'll be using most of your spells to blow crap up. They're really easy to build, too. Either go straight-up sorcerer, or add in a level of paladin (or 2 blackguard for evil characters) for the save bonuses and access to heavy armor and shields (which you'd use later in the game with Auto Still Spell).

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: If you take Bard at level, you must have at least 11 Charisma, which would hurt the Easy Adventurer build.  That build will steamroll through either the OC + Mines of Twin Summit (going to level 40), or SoU, HotU, and Sands of Fate (also going to level 40).  Remember that the OC and SoU both start at level 1, and HotU is designed to follow SoU.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Soloing a sorcerer or wizard is fine once you know how to play one. IMO it is not the place to start if you are unfamiliar with the game.
Playing a pure sorcerer can feel a bit like dealing with a glass cannon. And during the earlier levels it is most fragile and no cannon at all. You have to know your spells, because you will live, or die, by your spells.
There are builds that add defensive properties, like the Exalted sorceress does. But even that build starts out as, and remains a pure sorcerer for a long time.
